com.github.fge.grappa.parsers

Class BaseParser<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.grappa.parsers.BaseActions<V>
      • com.github.fge.grappa.parsers.BaseParser<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of the parser values
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContextAware<V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListeningParser

    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public abstract class BaseParser<V>
extends BaseActions<V>
    Base class of all parboiled parsers. Defines the basic rule creation methods.

    • Field Summary

      Matches nothing and always fails.

      • unicodeRange

        @Cached
@DontLabel
public Rule unicodeRange(int low,
                                 int high)
        Match a Unicode character range

        Note that this method will delegate to "regular" character matchers if part of, or all of, the specified range is into the basic multilingual plane.

        Parameters:
        low - the lower code point (inclusive)
        high - the upper code point (inclusive)
        Returns:
        a rule

      • regex

        @Cached
@DontLabel
public Rule regex(String regex)
        Match the input text using a Java regular expression

        A few important considerations:

        • the method used to match text is Matcher.lookingAt(); it means that the match will always be attempted at the current index in the input;
        • no flags are passed to Pattern.compile(String), therefore if you want case insensitive matches etc, you have to use the appropriate regex modifiers in the regex itself (for instance, (?i) for case insensitivity).
        Parameters:
        regex - the regex
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        Pattern, Matcher.lookingAt(), Matcher.end()

      • trie

        @Cached
public Rule trie(Collection<String> strings)
        Match one string among many using a trie

        Duplicate elements will be silently eliminated.

        Note that order of elements does not matter, and that this rule will always trie (err, try) and match the longest possible sequence. That is, if you build a rule with inputs "do" and "double" in this order and the input text is "doubles", then "double" will be matched. However, if the input text is "doubling" then "do" is matched instead.

        Note also that the minimum length of strings in a trie is 2.

        Parameters:
        strings - the list of strings for this trie
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        TrieMatcher, TrieNode

      • trie

        public Rule trie(String first,
        String second,
        String... others)
        Match one string among many using a trie

        This method delegates to trie(Collection).

        Parameters:
        first - the first string
        second - the second string
        others - other strings
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        TrieMatcher, TrieNode

      • trieIgnoreCase

        @Cached
public Rule trieIgnoreCase(Collection<String> strings)
        Match one string among many using a trie, case insensitive version

        Duplicate elements will be silently eliminated.

        Note that order of elements does not matter, and that this rule will always trie (err, try) and match the longest possible sequence. That is, if you build a rule with inputs "do" and "double" in this order and the input text is "doubles", then "double" will be matched. However, if the input text is "doubling" then "do" is matched instead.

        Note also that the minimum length of strings in a trie is 2.

        Parameters:
        strings - the list of strings for this trie
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        CaseInsensitiveTrieMatcher

      • trieIgnoreCase

        public Rule trieIgnoreCase(String first,
                  String second,
                  String... others)
        Match one string among many using a trie, case insensitive

        This method delegates to trieIgnoreCase(Collection).

        Parameters:
        first - the first string
        second - the second string
        others - other strings
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        CaseInsensitiveTrieMatcher

      • firstOf

        @DontLabel
public Rule firstOf(Object rule,
                     Object rule2,
                     Object... moreRules)
        Match the first rule of a series of rules

        When one rule matches, all others are ignored.

        Note: if you are considering matching one string among many, consider using trie(Collection)/trie(String, String, String...) instead.

        Parameters:
        rule - the first subrule
        rule2 - the second subrule
        moreRules - the other subrules
        Returns:
        a rule

@DontLabel
public Rule firstOf(Object[] rules)

        When one rule matches, all others are ignored.

        Parameters:
        rules - the subrules
        Returns:
        a rule

      • oneOrMore

        @DontLabel
public Rule oneOrMore(Object rule)
        Try and match a rule repeatedly, at least once

        This is in fact an alias for repeat(rule).min(1).

        Parameters:
        rule - the subrule
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        repeat(Object)

      • oneOrMore

        @DontLabel
public Rule oneOrMore(Object rule,
                       Object rule2,
                       Object... moreRules)
        Try and repeatedly match a set of rules, at least once

        This is in fact an alias for repeat(rule, rule2, ...).min(1).

        Parameters:
        rule - the first subrule
        rule2 - the second subrule
        moreRules - the other subrules
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        repeat(Object, Object, Object...)

      • join

        @DontLabel
public final JoinMatcherBootstrap<V,BaseParser<V>> join(Object rule)
        Kickstart a join rule

        Usages:

             return join(rule()).using(otherRule()).times(n);
     return join(rule()).using(otherRule()).min(n);

        etc. See JoinMatcherBuilder for more possible constructs.

        Parameters:
        rule - the joined rule (must not match an empty sequence!)
        Returns:
        a JoinMatcherBootstrap
        See Also:
        JoinMatcherBootstrap.using(Object)

      • join

        @DontLabel
public final JoinMatcherBootstrap<V,BaseParser<V>> join(Object rule,
                                                   Object rule2,
                                                   Object... moreRules)
        Kickstart a join rule

        Like join(Object), except that several rules are accepted as arguments.

        Parameters:
        rule - first rule
        rule2 - second rule
        moreRules - other rules
        Returns:
        a JoinMatcherBootstrap
        See Also:
        sequence(Object, Object, Object...)

      • repeat

        @DontLabel
public final RepeatMatcherBuilder<V> repeat(Object rule)
        Kickstart a repeat rule

        Usages:

             return repeat("Yes we can!").times(3);
     return repeat(someRule).min(2);
     // etc
        Parameters:
        rule - the rule to be repeated
        Returns:
        a builder

      • repeat

        @DontLabel
public final RepeatMatcherBuilder<V> repeat(Object rule,
                                       Object rule2,
                                       Object... moreRules)
        Kickstart a repeat rule

        Like repeat(Object), except several rules are accepted as arguments.

        Parameters:
        rule - first rule
        rule2 - second rule
        moreRules - other rules
        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:
        sequence(Object, Object, Object...)

      • test

        @Cached
@DontLabel
public Rule test(Object rule)
        Test a rule, but do not consume any input (predicate)

        Its success conditions are the same as the rule. Note that this rule will never consume any input, nor will it create a parse tree node.

        Note that the embedded rule can be arbitrarily complex, and this includes potential Actions which can act on the stack for instance; these will be executed here, unless you have chosen to annotate your rule, or parser class, with SkipActionsInPredicates.

        Parameters:
        rule - the subrule
        Returns:
        a new rule

      • test

        @DontLabel
public Rule test(Object rule,
                  Object rule2,
                  Object... moreRules)
        Test a set of rules, but do not consume any input
        Parameters:
        rule - the first subrule
        rule2 - the second subrule
        moreRules - the other subrules
        Returns:
        a new rule
        See Also:
        test(Object)

      • testNot

        @Cached
@DontLabel
public Rule testNot(Object rule)
        Test, without consuming an input, that a rule does not match

        The same warnings given in the description of test(Object) apply here.

        Parameters:
        rule - the subrule
        Returns:
        a rule

public Rule zeroOrMore(Object rule)

        Returns:
        a rule
        See Also:

public Rule zeroOrMore(Object rule,
                        Object rule2,

        Parameters:

        rule2 - the second subrule
        moreRules - the other subrules
        Returns:
        a rule

      • alpha

        public Rule alpha()
        ALPHA as defined by RFC 5234, appendix B, section 1: ASCII letters

        Therefore a-z, A-Z.

        Returns:
        a rule

      • bit

        Returns:

      • asciiChars

        public Rule asciiChars()
        CHAR as defined by RFC 5234, appendix B, section 1: ASCII, except NUL

        That is, 0x01 to 0x7f.

        Returns:
        a rule

        CRLF as defined by RFC 5234, appendix B, section 1 (\r\n
        Returns:
        a rule

      • ctl

        public Rule ctl()
        CTL as defined by RFC 5234, appendix B, section 1: control characters

        0x00-0x1f, plus 0x7f.

        Returns:
        a rule

      • digit

        public Rule digit()
        DIGIT as defined by RFC 5234, appendix B, section 1 (0 to 9)
        Returns:
        a rule

      • dquote

        public Rule dquote()
        DQUOTE as defined by RFC 5234, appendix B, section 1 "
        Returns:
        a rule

      • hexDigit

        public Rule hexDigit()
        Hexadecimal digits, case insensitive

        Note: RFC 5234 only defines HEXDIG for uppercase letters (A to F). Use hexDigitUpperCase() for this definition. Use hexDigitLowerCase() for lowercase letters only.

        Returns:
        a rule

      • vchar

        public Rule vchar()
        VCHAR as defined by RFC 5234, appendix B, section 1: ASCII "visible"

        Letters, @, etc etc. Note that this excludes whitespace characters!

        Returns:
        a rule

        Returns:
        a rule

      • ACTION

        public static <T> Action<T> ACTION(boolean expression)
        Explicitly marks the wrapped expression as an action expression. parboiled transforms the wrapped expression into an Action instance during parser construction.
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to turn into an Action
        Returns:
        the Action wrapping the given expression

      • fromCharLiteral

        @DontExtend
protected Rule fromCharLiteral(char c)
        Used internally to convert the given character literal to a parser rule. You can override this method, e.g. for specifying a Sequence that automatically matches all trailing whitespace after the character.
        Parameters:
        c - the character
        Returns:
        the rule

      • fromStringLiteral

        @DontExtend
protected Rule fromStringLiteral(String string)
        Used internally to convert the given string literal to a parser rule. You can override this method, e.g. for specifying a Sequence that automatically matches all trailing whitespace after the string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string
        Returns:
        the rule

      • fromCharArray

        @DontExtend
protected Rule fromCharArray(char[] array)
        Used internally to convert the given char array to a parser rule. You can override this method, e.g. for specifying a Sequence that automatically matches all trailing whitespace after the characters.
        Parameters:
        array - the char array
        Returns:
        the rule

      • toRules

        @DontExtend
public Rule[] toRules(Object... objects)
        Converts the given object array to an array of rules.
        Parameters:
        objects - the objects to convert
        Returns:
        the rules corresponding to the given objects

      • toRule

        @DontExtend
public Rule toRule(Object obj)
        Converts the given object to a rule. This method can be overriden to enable the use of custom objects directly in rule specifications.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to convert
        Returns:
        the rule corresponding to the given object
